answerText: muscular dystrophy[10] Patients with muscular dystrophy lack sufficient amount of this protein that allow actin filaments to bind correctly with a certain type of glycans.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 11 | 12 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The Becker type of this disease is inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern while the Duchenne type is most common. For 10 points each:  [10] Name this disease that results in skeletal muscle wasting. It can often be identified by a high level of creatine kinase.
